Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_nbco7jPzHo1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/Y1XdMLUcd_c" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Never has the annihilation of Kerbin felt so whimsical. Andrew Hansen’s newest cinematic raises the question of what Kerbals can do about an asteroid that’s headed straight for Kerbin. They can intercept it or they can evacuate the planet. What will they choose? What will become of Kerbin? Watch and find out.</p>
Congrants, Andrew! Always nice to see a friendly YouTuber get featured on the KSP dailies...

Very Bob Fitch-esc if you ask me. Fun. Simple. And entertaining

AND DAMMIT I WAS TOO LATE WITH MY NEW VIDEO..... better wait until next week

I shall not rest my desire for the daily kerbal slot until my cinematics are a household name. Then again, perhaps Squad have learnt from when they used to spotlight Nassault every time he made something new xD
Thank you very much! This has been a dream come true, to be featured like this!

Well done Andrew, that was well deserved.

Cupcake...

This Daily Kerbal thread has become a YouTuber takeover .

Edited September 4, 2014 by Avera9eJoe
I lol'd... "fortunately the ship randomly bumped into an asteroid... BANG!" O_O
I like the idea and might try it on my save game. I like the idea of a space station around Kerbin, or preferably around another planet, with loads and loads of Kerbals.
very nice video! So long Kerbin! Thanks for all the fish.
Lol I like this video, watched this so many times
